newsitem.title: MEXICO: Geo shareholders approve capital increase.
newsitem.headline: Geo shareholders approve capital increase.

text.p: Shareholders of Corporacion Geo, a developer of low-income housing, approved on Monday a capital increase that involves the issue of 29 million new shares.

A Geo source said the new share placement, approved on Monday at an annual meeting, would mean the issue of 13.8 million shares to the public and 10.2 million shares that would stay in the company's treasury.
Another five million shares would be issued to back the launch of a convertible bond offered to employees and executives, he said
The source confirmed the issue of up to $50 million in debt to support the company's expansion plans.
Luis Antonio de Leon, an analyst at Valores Finamex brokerage, estimated the share issue would cause about 18.6 percent share dilution.

Another analyst, Gordon Lee of Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, said the share offering would raise around $60 million at current prices. GEO b shares were trading at 38 pesos in the Mexican market on Tuesday.
